description:
Sporothrix schenckii is a dimorphic fungus that can cause a rare mycotic infection known as sporotrichosis. It is a filamentous fungus that can exist in two forms: a mold form at lower temperatures (25°C) and a yeast form at higher temperatures (37°C), which is the pathogenic form.

The species Sporothrix schenckii 1099-18 is a specific strain or isolate of this fungus. It was likely isolated from a clinical sample and assigned the identification number 1099-18. This particular strain may have been used in research or clinical studies to understand the biology, genetics, or pathogenicity of Sporothrix schenckii.

Sporothrix schenckii is known to infect humans and animals, primarily through traumatic inoculation of the fungus from contaminated soil, plants, or organic matter. The infection can manifest as a localized cutaneous form or a more disseminated systemic form, depending on the host's immune response.

Further details about the specific characteristics, genomic features, or virulence factors of the Sporothrix schenckii 1099-18 strain would require more in-depth research and information from scientific literature or microbial culture collections.
